newsitem.title: UK: UK govt to "vigorously pursue" budget leak source.
newsitem.headline: UK govt to "vigorously pursue" budget leak source.

text.p: The British government will vigorously pursue an inquiry into who leaked budget documents to a tabloid newspaper on the eve of the budget speech in parliament, senior government officials said on Tuesday.
"We take this extremely seriously and we totally deprecate the leaking of any material. This will be pursued vigorously by the government," the official said.

Any civil servant found responsible for the leak would face very severe disciplinary measures, he said. The official said an injunction was taken out on Monday night by Treasury lawyers to prevent the Daily Mirror publishing sensitive budget details.

But the injunction, granted by a judge around an hour after the Daily Mirror advised Prime Minister John Major's Downing Street office it had the papers, was "overtaken" by a legal agreement between the Mirror and the Treasury's lawyers, the official said.
The Mirror did not publish details of the papers, saying it had acted out of a sense of "public duty" and a desire to avoid chaos in financial markets.
